page.title: 04Natural History-Witton
page.content: {Mill Common}has delightful variety of flowers backed by blackthorn & sycamore.Attracts blackberry & sloe searchers in autumn.There is a neglected wetland area fast becoming overgrown with bullrushes & willows,but sufficently flooded by winter rains to act as a breeding ground for ducks and coots.Occasionally there is a coypu. {Crostwight Heath}is an area of sandy heath covered in gorse,fern & some heather.Lovely in spring,it is the haunt of gold & greenfinches & yellowhammers {Lakes & Ponds}N. of Crostwight Heath is small lake,privately owned & stocked with fish:is mecca for toads & frogs in the spring:often found crossing roads in the lakes' vicinity {Birds}are many including owls, woodpeckers,swallows & housemartins.
